message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.RO, cs.SY, cs.CR 

This paper proposes a framework for augmenting a Markov decision process (MDP) with constraints described in formal languages, which is relevant to artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG) research. The paper also evaluates the proposed methods using Deep Q-Networks and Proximal Policy Optimization, which are commonly used in robotics (cs.RO) and control systems (cs.SY) research. Additionally, the paper discusses potential-based reward shaping, which is relevant to cryptography and security (cs.CR) research.
